column2: When escaping special characters using a meta-character like backslash or ampersand, the meta-character has to be escaped first to avoid double-escaping, and conversely it has to be unescaped last to avoid double-unescaping.
column4: This replacement may produce '&' characters that are double-unescaped [["here"|"relative:///bin/public:81:10:82:35"]].

column2: Writing user input directly to an HTTP response allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
Writing user input directly to an HTTP response allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

column1: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
column2: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.
